extendedIngredients.name: edamame
extendedIngredients.original: 2 cups (6 ounces) frozen edamame (soybeans) in their pods
extendedIngredients.originalName: cups frozen edamame (soybeans) in their pods

extendedIngredients.name: ribs celery
extendedIngredients.original: 4 large tender celery ribs, plus 2 tablespoons coarsely chopped celery leaves
extendedIngredients.originalName: tender celery ribs, plus 2 tablespoons coarsely chopped celery leaves

extendedIngredients.name: scallions
extendedIngredients.original: 2 scallions, white and tender green parts, thinly sliced on the diagonal
extendedIngredients.originalName: scallions, white and tender green parts, thinly sliced on the diagonal

title: Celery Slaw with Edamame
summary: Celery Slaw with Edamame is a gluten free and vegan recipe with 4 servings. One portion of this dish contains around 5g of protein, 6g of fat, and a total of 93 calories. For 61 cents per serving, this recipe covers 9% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. 1 person has tried and liked this recipe. It works well as a side dish. The Fourth Of July will be even more special with this recipe. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 45 minutes. A mixture of sea salt, tender celery ribs, edamame in their pods, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so flavorful. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 37%. This score is rather bad. Try Edamame, Celery and Fennel Salad with Candied Lemon, Celery Apple Edamame Peanut Butter Salad, and Asian Celery, Fennel, and Edamame Salad with Candied Lemon, from 'Flour, Too for similar recipes.
instructions: In a food processor or with a sharp knife, slice the celery as thinly as possible. Put the celery in a bowl of ice water and crisp for 15 minutes. Drain and pat dry. Wipe out the bowl and return the celery to it.                                              In a medium saucepan of boiling water, cook the soybeans for 5 minutes. Drain and refresh under cold water. Shell the soybeans and pat dry. Add the soybeans, scallions, cilantro, mint and celery leaves to the celery and toss well.                                              In a bowl, whisk the lime juice with the oil. Pour the dressing over the vegetables, season with salt, toss and serve.

steps.step: In a food processor or with a sharp knife, slice the celery as thinly as possible.
Put the celery in a bowl of ice water and crisp for 15 minutes.
Drain and pat dry. Wipe out the bowl and return the celery to it.
In a medium saucepan of boiling water, cook the soybeans for 5 minutes.
Drain and refresh under cold water. Shell the soybeans and pat dry.
Add the soybeans, scallions, cilantro, mint and celery leaves to the celery and toss well.
In a bowl, whisk the lime juice with the oil.
Pour the dressing over the vegetables, season with salt, toss and serve.
